snippet: A shift to allow more than 56,000 people who fled Central America to stay in the United States for several more years amounts to an unannounced departure from policy....
abstract: Obama administration is delaying deportation proceedings for over 56,000 immigrants who fled to United States from Central America since 2014; officials say delays, which amount to departure from publicized goal of rushing such cases through immigration courts, are being made as cost-saving measure due to lapse in electronic monitoring of immigrants.
lead_paragraph: A shift to allow more than 56,000 people who fled Central America to stay in the United States for several more years amounts to an unannounced departure from policy.

headline.main: Obama Administration Is Quietly Delaying Thousands of Deportation Cases
headline.print_headline: Quiet Delays in Deportation Let Thousands Stay for Years
